title: PHPheader_register_callback()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPheader_register_callback()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Definition and Usage
The header_register_callback() function calls a header function (will be 
executed after PHP has prepared all headers to be sent, and before any other 
output is sent).
Syntax
header_register_callback(
callback
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
callback
Required. Specifies a callback function
Technical Details
Return Value:
TRUE on success. FALSE on failure
PHP Version:
5.4+

★
+1

quiz.question:
What is and before any other 
output?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of and before any other 
output is 'sent)'.

quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.
